source.javadoc:
Enumeration for localized messages formats used in exceptions messages.

The constants in this enumeration represent the available formats as localized strings. These formats are intended to be localized using simple properties files, using the constant name as the key and the property value as the message format. The source English format is provided in the constants themselves to serve both as a reminder for developers to understand the parameters needed by each format, as a basis for translators to create localized properties files, and as a default format if some translation is missing.

2.2 $Id: LocalizedFormats.java 1442377 2013-02-04 21:31:42Z erans $

Simple constructor.
sourceFormat source English format to use when no localized version is available

method.name: getLocalizedString
method.comment: the value of the resource is the translated format
either the locale is not supported or the resource is unknown don't translate and fall back to using the source format
